Key Match Events: The Celtics ripped off a 15-0 run to pull away from the Nuggets in the fourth quarter.
Boston sealed the win with a 15-0 run during the fourth quarter.
Jayson Tatum dropped a game-high 29 points to lead the Celtics to a hard-fought win over the Nuggets at Ball Arena.
Pre-Game Insights: The Denver Nuggets knew what to expect from the Boston Celtics. Or so they thought.
Nuggets head coach Michael Malone said Monday of the Celtics, ‘No matter what you do, they’re gonna get 50 3s up.... That is their thing offensively. ‘We’re gonna just put a lot of 3s up.'
Post-Match Reflections: Jrue Holiday praised Kristaps Porzingis for his standout performance vs. the Nuggets.
Jayson Tatum (29 points, six assists) and Kristaps Porzingis (25 points, 11 rebounds) were the stars for the C's.
The Celtics finished their four-game road trip with a 3-1 record.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics shot 12-for-35 from deep (34.3 percent) while the Nuggets went 14-for-36 (38.9 percent).
Boston will return home to take on the Sacramento Kings on Friday. Tip-off for that game is set for 7:30 p.m. ET on NBC Sports Boston.
The Celtics have dominated inside the arc with 18 points in the paint to the Nuggets' two.
Others: The Celtics are now 5-5 against teams ranked in the top 10 in defensive rating, per Cleaning the Glass tracking, but that mark drops to 2-4 when you zoom in on teams that are top 10 in both defensive rating and point differential.
By comparison, OKC is 7-2 against those teams and Cleveland is 3-1, with Boston being the lone loss.
